body_html:
BTW, you are getting float64 vs float32 error because implementation only supports float32, but you are feeding it float64 arrays. To convert it to float32, use this: x = np.array([[random.random() for i in range(198)] for j in range(2384)]).astype(np.float32)

However, that still fails, but with a different error....are you sure you are using K-means correctly? I couldn't find documentation for it. That thing in "contrib" are there because they are not mature enough to move to core, so they could be broken and in process of getting fixed (or removed). In this case, it was covered in TensorFlow dev summit, so I would guess it's still actively supported

@agarwal-ashish
